item.title: Betsy add a quote by Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description: "Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant." -- Robert Louis Stevenson

item.title: Betsy add a quote by Natalie Babbitt
item.description: "Don't be afraid of death; be afraid of an unlived life. You don't have to live forever, you just have to live." -- Natalie Babbitt

item.title: Betsy add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Betsy add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Betsy add a quote by Jonathan Swift
item.description: "May you live every day of your life." -- Jonathan Swift

item.title: Betsy add a quote by Ann Patchett
item.description: "Never be so focused on what you're looking for that you overlook the thing you actually find." -- Ann Patchett

item.title: Betsy add a quote by Niels Bohr
item.description: "An expert is a person who has made all the mistakes that can be made in a very narrow field." -- Niels Bohr

item.title: Betsy add a quote by Judith Viorst
item.description: "Strength is the capacity to break a Hershey bar into four pieces with your bare hands - and then eat just one of the pieces." -- Judith Viorst

item.title: Betsy add a quote by George Sand
item.description: "Guard well within yourself that treasure, kindness. Know how to give without hesitation, how to lose without regret, how to acquire without meanness." -- George Sand

item.title: Betsy add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose. You're on your own. And you know what you know. And YOU are the one who'll decide where to go..." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Betsy add a quote by Elizabeth Taylor
item.description: "The problem with people who have no vices is that generally you can be pretty sure they're going to have some pretty annoying virtues." -- Elizabeth Taylor

item.title: Betsy add a quote by Philip Roth
item.description: "Everybody else is working to change, persuade, tempt and control them. The best readers come to fiction to be free of all that noise." -- Philip Roth

item.title: Betsy add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Betsy add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Betsy add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "You may not control all the events that happen to you, but you can decide not to be reduced by them." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Betsy add a quote by Lois Lowry
item.description: "It is very risky. But each time a child opens a book, he pushes open the gate that separates him from Elsewhere." -- Lois Lowry

item.title: Betsy add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "The plain state of being human is dramatic enough for anyone; you don't need to be a heroin addict or a performance poet to experience extremity. You just have to love someone." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Betsy add a quote by Anthony Trollope
item.description: "A small daily task, if it be really daily, will beat the labours of a spasmodic Hercules." -- Anthony Trollope

item.title: Betsy add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "All that glisters is not gold; Often have you heard that told: Many a man his life hath sold But my outside to behold: Gilded tombs do worms enfold." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Betsy add a quote by Orson Welles
item.description: "My doctor told me to stop having intimate dinners for four. Unless there are three other people." -- Orson Welles

item.title: Betsy add a quote by Katherine Anne Porter
item.description: "The past is never where you think you left it." -- Katherine Anne Porter

item.title: Betsy add a quote by L. Frank Baum
item.description: "There is no place like home." -- L. Frank Baum

item.title: Betsy add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Happiness consists in getting enough sleep. Just that, nothing more." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Betsy add a quote by Tina Fey
item.description: "Some people say, “Never let them see you cry.” I say, if you’re so mad you could just cry, then cry. It terrifies everyone." -- Tina Fey

item.title: Betsy add a quote by Alexander Pope
item.description: "To err is human, to forgive, divine." -- Alexander Pope

item.title: Betsy add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "In the spring, at the end of the day, you should smell like dirt." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Betsy add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "Resist much, obey little." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Betsy add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "It's really a wonder that I haven't dropped all my ideals, because they seem so absurd and impossible to carry out. Yet I keep them, because in spite of everything, I still believe that people are really good at heart." -- Anne Frank

item.title: Betsy add a quote by Joyce Carol Oates
item.description: "I never change, I simply become more myself." -- Joyce Carol Oates

item.title: Betsy add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "Your father, Jo. He never loses patience, never doubts or complains, but always hopes, and works and waits so cheerfully that one is ashamed to do otherwise before him." -- Louisa May Alcott
